citation.article-title: Goodfellowia gen. nov., a new genus of the Pseudonocardineae related to Actinoalloteichus, containing Goodfellowia coeruleoviolacea gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Goodfellowia (Good.fel.low′i.a. N.L. fem. n. Goodfellowia named for Michael Goodfellow, a microbiologist at the University of Newcastle, in recognition of his contributions to microbial systematics).
Branched substrate mycelium (approx. 0.5 μm in diameter) and, on some media, aerial mycelia are produced.
Ovoid conidia are produced by fragmentation of substrate mycelium.
Contain meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diamino acid.
The whole-cell sugar pattern consists of galactose and ribose.

The phospholipid pattern consists of diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylethanolamine containing hydroxylated fatty acids and traces of phosphatidylinositol and phosphatidylinositol mannosides.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-10(H4).
Have a fatty-acid profile rich in branched-chain and saturated components including 10-methyl-branched heptadecanoic acid and anteiso-branched 2-hydroxy fatty acids.
Phylogenetically nearest neighbour is the genus Actinoalloteichus.
